subject: Philosophy
title: Skepticism: Suspend Judgment
description: A fast breakdown of Skepticism: Suspend Judgment for builders.

hook.text: The ancient skeptics said: for every argument, there's an equally strong counterargument. So believe nothing.

buildup.text: Pyrrho of Elis founded skepticism after traveling to India and encountering radically different worldviews.

discovery.text: His method: suspend judgment. Don't commit to any belief. This frees you from the anxiety of being wrong.

twist.text: Skeptics still lived normal lives. They followed customs and instincts â€” they just didn't claim to know they were right.

climax.text: Skepticism later inspired Descartes's method of doubt and the entire empiricist tradition.

punchline.text: The wisest position might be: I don't know.

quiz.question: What did Pyrrhonian skeptics recommend?
options: Suspending judgment to achieve mental tranquility
